revisions.rev:
{{notability|date=August 2011}} {{primary sources|date=August 2011}} {{lowercase|cdrdao}} {{ infobox OS | name = cdrdao | logo = | screenshot = [[Image:cdrdao.png|250px]] | caption = cdrdao reading a CD | developer = | programming language = [[C++]] | released = | latest_release_version = 1.2.3 | latest_release_date = {{release date and age|2009|10|05}} | latest_test_version = | latest_test_date = | language = | license = GPL | working_state = Current | website = [http://cdrdao.sourceforge.net/ cdrdao.sourceforge.net] }} '''cdrdao''' is [[open source software]] for [[authoring]] and [[ripping]] of [[CD-ROM]]s. The software is released under the [[GNU General Public License|GPL]]. Cdrdao records audio or data [[CD-R]]s in [[Disk-At-Once]] mode based on a textual description of the CD contents. The ''cdrdao'' program is run from the [[command line]] and has no [[graphical user interface]], except for third-party ones such as [[K3b]] (Linux) or XDuplicator (Windows).
cdrdao is [[cross-platform]] software and is reported to work on [[FreeBSD]], [[Linux]], [[Microsoft Windows]], [[OS/2]] and [[UnixWare]].
==External links==
*[http://cdrdao.sourceforge.net Cdrdao project home page] *[http://linuxreviews.org/man/cdrdao/ cdrdao man page] *[http://users.forthnet.gr/ath/axatis/XProject/XDuplicator/index.htm XDuplicator website] {{Free-software-stub}} {{multimedia-software-stub}} {{Optical disc image software}}
